page.title: 08BRAYTON IN THE PAST
page.content: There are lots of old & new houses in Brayton. There is a house in{Turton {Sq.}that was built{140}years ago by a sailor. The trees on the green are in memory of village men who died in the {First World War.}There are{19 trees. } There was a{pinfold }on the green where people put stray cattle. If you found one of your animals in it you had to pay a fine. There is an old railway line that runs through Brayton. It is part of the Leeds-Goole line. There were{2 mills}in Brayton at the beginning of the century, one on {Mill Lane}and the other on{The Mount. The pubs in Brayton date from{1822}but then they were called{White Horse}and {White Hart}(now Swan &{Grey Horse}). In Brayton about{30}years ago there was no{Brayton Junior School}no Poplars and no{Mayfield Estate. {Owen Brownbridge & Paul Moody
